episodeTitle: A Special Presentation Related to the Movie! The Fierce Onslaught of the Amigo Pirates!
description: The Amigo Pirates attack Little East Blue seeking Boss the beetle. Captain Largo reveals his Ami Ami no Mi powers, trapping Zoro and Sanji in nets. Boss begins a premature molting transformation and uses fire to free the trapped Straw Hats before collapsing from the strain.

events.title: Largo Reveals the Ami Ami no Mi
events.description: Captain Largo of the Amigo Pirates reveals he has eaten the Ami Ami no Mi, a Devil Fruit that grants him the ability to produce nets from his body. He demonstrates this power by creating sticky nets with a claimed '120% success rate' for capturing anything.
events.significance: First appearance and revelation of the Ami Ami no Mi Devil Fruit in the One Piece series. This anime-only Devil Fruit showcases unique abilities including material absorption and net transformation.

quotes.text: I have eaten the Ami Ami no Mi! My nets have a 120% success rate!
quotes.speaker: Largo
quotes.context: Largo reveals his Devil Fruit powers to the Straw Hats

events.title: Zoro and Sanji Trapped in Largo's Nets
events.description: Zoro and Sanji attempt to attack Largo but are captured by his net abilities. Despite their strength and combat skills, both fighters become ensnared in Largo's sticky, high-tensile-strength nets, leaving the Straw Hats' main fighters temporarily incapacitated.
events.significance: Demonstrates the effectiveness of Largo's Devil Fruit powers against formidable opponents, creating a crisis situation for the Straw Hat crew.

events.title: Largo's Material-Enhanced Net Abilities
events.description: Largo demonstrates advanced applications of his Ami Ami no Mi by ingesting various materials including metal, boiling water, and fire. His nets take on the properties of ingested materials, creating iron nets, flaming nets, and other specialized variations for different combat situations.
events.significance: Reveals the versatility and danger of the Ami Ami no Mi, showing it's not just a simple net-creation ability but has transformative properties based on material consumption.

events.title: Boss Attempts to Surrender
events.description: Boss the giant beetle attempts to surrender himself to the Amigo Pirates to spare the villagers of Little East Blue from harm. This selfless act demonstrates Boss's protective nature toward the people who have cared for him, particularly Yoko.
events.significance: Character development moment showing Boss's loyalty and willingness to sacrifice himself, establishing the emotional stakes of the conflict.

events.title: Luffy Intervenes to Protect Boss
events.description: Luffy refuses to let Boss surrender and intervenes, declaring his intention to protect both Boss and Little East Blue. Despite being at a disadvantage with his crewmates trapped, Luffy stands firm against the Amigo Pirates.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's core character trait of protecting his friends and those he cares about, regardless of the odds. This moment reinforces why the villagers begin to trust pirates despite Yoko's initial prejudice.

quotes.text: I won't let you take Boss!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares his protection of Boss against the Amigo Pirates

events.title: Boss's Premature Molting Transformation
events.description: Boss's skin suddenly begins to shed in a molting transformation, despite it being too soon for this natural process. He emerges with a new teal color, larger size, light green fur, and enhanced tusks. The transformation temporarily grants him increased power but leaves him weakened afterward.
events.significance: Reveals Boss's unique biological ability to molt and transform, increasing his power level. This premature transformation becomes crucial for the rescue but comes at a cost to Boss's health.

events.title: Boss Breathes Fire to Free the Straw Hats
events.description: In his newly transformed state, Boss emits fire from his horn to burn away Largo's nets, successfully freeing Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji. However, the exertion proves too much for his premature transformation, and Boss begins to collapse from the strain.
events.significance: First demonstration of Boss's fire-breathing ability, which becomes the key to breaking Largo's supposedly unbreakable nets. The rescue comes at great personal cost to Boss.

events.title: Boss Collapses After Transformation
events.description: After freeing the Straw Hats with his fire breath, Boss begins to fall as the premature molting takes its toll on his body. The transformation was too soon for his body to handle, leaving him vulnerable despite his temporary power increase.
events.significance: Sets up the cliffhanger for the next episode and establishes the stakes - while Boss saved the Straw Hats, he's now in danger himself, requiring them to protect him while he recovers.

quotes.text: I have eaten the Ami Ami no Mi! My nets have a 120% success rate!
quotes.speaker: Largo
quotes.context: Largo reveals his Devil Fruit powers

quotes.text: I won't let you take Boss!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares his protection of Boss

themes.description: The episode explores themes of self-sacrifice through Boss's willingness to surrender himself and his subsequent premature transformation to save the Straw Hats. Luffy's refusal to abandon Boss reinforces the theme of protecting those who cannot protect themselves.
themes.symbolism: Boss's molting and transformation symbolizes painful growth and the cost of protecting others.

themes.description: Continues the arc's theme of Yoko learning to see pirates differently through the Straw Hats' actions, particularly their willingness to fight for Boss and Little East Blue.
themes.symbolism: The Straw Hats' defense of the village mirrors the protective role Yoko's Marine father once played.

characterSpotlights.development: Largo is established as a formidable opponent with unique Devil Fruit abilities. His Mexican mariachi aesthetic and Spanish-influenced speech patterns give him a distinctive personality. His cruelty is shown through his willingness to destroy the village.
keyActions: Reveals Ami Ami no Mi Devil Fruit powers
Traps Zoro and Sanji in nets
quotes: I have eaten the Ami Ami no Mi! My nets have a 120% success rate!

characterSpotlights.development: Boss demonstrates both vulnerability and incredible power. His willingness to sacrifice himself shows his gentle nature, while his transformation reveals his combat potential. The premature molting establishes the limits and costs of his abilities.
keyActions: Attempts to surrender to protect Little East Blue
Breathes fire to free the Straw Hats

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's unwavering determination to protect Boss despite the odds reinforces his character. Even with his crew trapped and facing a powerful Devil Fruit user, he refuses to back down.
quotes: I won't let you take Boss!

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-only filler content created to promote One Piece Film: Strong World. None of these events, characters, or locations appear in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode is part of a 4-episode arc (426-429) that serves as a prologue to One Piece Film: Strong World, introducing the film's antagonist Shiki.

sources.title: Little East Blue Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Ami Ami no Mi is an anime-only Devil Fruit that never appears in the manga. It's called the Net-Net Fruit in the Funimation dub.

sources.title: Ami Ami no Mi - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Largo's distinctive laugh 'shik-shik-shik' is meant to sound like sobbing, fitting his melancholic personality and tendency to lament while playing guitar.
The episode achieved a 12.2% TV rating in Japan, ranking #3 for its timeslot.
Boss was originally created by Dr. Indigo as part of Shiki's army of mutant animals designed to conquer the world, establishing a connection to the Strong World film.
